page.title: 17Springthorpe Church. Outside
page.content: {The Church of St. George and Lawrence. When we first got to the church we saw the church cross next to the path in the graveyard. Then we started to look at the windows and doors to see how old they were. At the bottom of the tower there is a good herringbone zig zag pattern in the stonework. On the side of the tower there is a narrow plain Saxon arch. This made us think that part of the church might have been built before the Norman invasion of England. The church is built from limestone and from the outside we could see where the original nave was. We could also see a bit of the chancel from where we were standing. When we went in the porchway we could see a Norman arch above the door. It is decorated with a dogtooth pattern. The pillars at the side of the door are decorated too.
